committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to declare July 2, 1976, a legal public holiday and to designate July 2, 3, 4, and 5, 1976, as a period of commemoration of America's Bicentennial.

summary.text: Provides for the declaring of July 2, 1976, as a legal public holiday. Designates July 2, 3, 4, and 5, 1976, as a period of commemoration of America's Bicentennial. Requests the President to issue a proclamation designating such period as a period of commemoration of America's Bicentennial. Requests the President to ask Governors, mayors, other politicans, and friends of this Nation from abroad to participate in the celebration and activities planned for such period.

titles.title: A bill to declare July 2, 1976, a legal public holiday and to designate July 2, 3, 4, and 5, 1976, as a period of commemoration of America's Bicentennial.
